title: Financial literacy and gender difference in loan performance
excerpt: We use data from a major peer-to-peer lending marketplace in China to study whether female and male investors evaluate loan performance differently.
citation: Chen, J., Jiang, J., & Liu, Y. J. (2018). Financial literacy and gender difference in loan performance. Journal of Empirical Finance , 48, 307-320.

title: Social heterogeneity and local bias in peer-to-peer lending: Evidence from China
excerpt: This paper investigates the presence of local bias in the peer-to-peer (P2P) lending market and explores the social heterogeneous factors that may affect the formulation of the investor's local bias.
citation: Jiang, J., Liu, Y. J., & Lu, R. (2020). Social heterogeneity and local bias in peer-to-peer lending: Evidence from China. Journal of Comparative Economics, 48(2), 302-324.

title: Proper fund size: a perspective from both investors and fund managers
excerpt: This paper proposes the notion of the proper size interval for funds and the market redemption return in fund markets.
citation: Zhang, L., Jiang, J., & An, Y. (2022). Proper fund size: a perspective from both investors and fund managers. Quantitative Finance, 22(5), 923-942.
